poem:
"Echoes of a Trade in Flux"

Mornings teem with spectral ships, no anchor in Red Sea.
Journeys pause, where Suez was, now sketches of a spree.
Germany, your vials wait, on breath of Asian gust,
A show of trade in stasis, couched in a can's trust.
In this dance of homeless freight, finds metaphoric rust,
Lifeboat or a millstone, sweet economical dust.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘Good chance’ UK may have fallen into technical recession; shipping firms continue to avoid Red Sea – business live 1.44pm GMT The shipment delays caused by vessels avoiding the Red Sea (and thus the Suez Canal) is causing problems for Germany’s chemicals industry. Germany’s chemicals sector relies on Asia for around a third of its imports from outside Europe. Martina Nighswonger, CEO and owner of Gechem GmbH & Co KG, which mixes and bottles chemicals". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
